DOC.brief_summary: Severe sepsis induces significant changes in expression of insulin- and toll-like receptors, cytokines, markers of apoptosis, and activation of t- and b-lymphocytes.
DOC.brief_title: Alterations of Immunologic Mediators During Severe Sepsis
DOC.detailed_description: In patients at early stage of severe sepsis, we investigate the expression of pro- and anti-inflammatory cytokines, chemokines, adhesion-molecules, toll-like receptors, insulin-receptors, markers of apoptosis und of t- and b-cell-activation on a mRNA level.
DOC.criteria: age >= 18 y agreement with study procedures 3 of 4 SIRScriteria proven or highly suspected infection 2 or more sepsisinduced organ failures start of first sepsisinduced organ failure within the last 36 hours nonagreement with study procedures signs of severe sepsis with organ failure > 36 hours chronic immunocompromising diseases chronic therapy with antiinflammatory drugs noncurable cancer chronic renal failure with hemodialysis pregnancy or breastfeeding
